page.title: 15VILLAGE LIFE IN 1915 PART 2
page.content: WALKING WAS THE MOST POPULAR PASTIME.THERE WERE MORE GRASS FIELDS AND FOOTPATHS.WILD FLOWERS WERE PICKED;VIOLETS,PRIMROSES AND DAISIES.STREET GAMES WERE CONKERS(HORSE CHESTNUTS),WHIP AND TOP,MARBLES AND BOWLING WITH A BICYCLE WHEEL.A VILLAGE FEAST WAS HELD EVERY YEAR ON THE RIVER BANK.OLDER GIRLS DID SEWING,KNITTING AND CROCHET OR MET FOR A SING-SONG ON THE HARMONIUM OR ORGAN.SOME BOYS STILL AT SCHOOL HELPED THE FARMERS.THESE'DAY BOYS'LOOKED AFTER COWS AND HORSES ON GRASS VERGES AND DYKE SIDES.THIS WAS CALLED TENTING.GIRLS HELPED THEIR MOTHERS AT HOME BY COOKING IN THE SIDE OVEN,CLEANING,SEWING AND MENDING.THE FATHERS ROSE AT 5 a.m AND MADE THE COAL FIRE,BEFORE HAVING A CUP OF TEA.HE WORKED FROM 6 am TO 3 pm.
